name: Rural eConnectivity Pilot Program
objective: The ReConnect Program provides loans, grants, and loan/grant combination awards to facilitate broadband deployment in rural areas. An essential goal of the ReConnect Program is to expand broadband service to rural areas without sufficient access to broadband, defined at the time of the funding notice (at a minimum: 25 megabits per second (Mbps) downstream and 3 Mbps upstream). In facilitating the expansion of broadband services and infrastructure, the program will fuel long-term rural economic development and opportunities in rural America.
assistance_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals

results.description: For FY 24, the program received 147 applications totaling $1.9 Billion in requested funding.  Through the end of FY 24, 10 awards have been approved.  It is expected that approximately 50 additional awards will be made from this applicant pool in the first quarter of FY25.

rules_regulations: See Forms and Resources for a list of all official published information: https://www.usda.gov/reconnect/forms-and-resources.  Regulations for the program may be found at 7 CFR 1740.
